description:
Authoritarian parent behavior summary score is based on 13 items from the Parenting Style Questionnaire Short Form (PSQ-SF). Each item is scored on a 5-point scale (from 1: never to 5: always). The total score is the sum of all 13 items divided by 13 (range 1 to 5). The highest calculated score indicates the preferred parently style. Authoritarian parent are high on acceptance and behavioral control, and low on psychological control, conceptualized as rational, warm, encouraging, and controlling in a way that promotes child autonomy. [Robinson, C. C., Mandleco, B., Olsen, S. F., & Hart, C. H. (1995). Authoritative, authoritarian, and permissive parenting practices: Development of a new measure. Psychological Reports, 77(3, Pt 1), 819-830.](https://doi.org/10.2466/pr0.1995.77.3.819)

[Search for all PSQ variables within this dataset](https://sleepdata.org/datasets/pats/variables?search=psq)
